item.title: [Delta] absX and absY in another class than client
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

PlayerHandler.java:46: non-static variable absX cannot be referenced from a stat ic context if (client.isInHungerLobby(client.absX, client.absY) && (players[i] != null) && !players[i].disconnected) { ^ PlayerHandler.java:46: non-static variable absY cannot be referenced from a stat ic context if (client.isInHungerLobby(client.absX, client.absY) && (players[i] != null) && !players[i].disconnected) { ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .
L0l

item.title: [Delta] absX and absY in another class than client
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

client.absX

If the variable is in another class, reference it from another used instance variable of the class (client).

item.title: [Delta] absX and absY in another class than client
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

define them in there or try this:

add this at the top like
class {
then add

client c;

public Otherclass(client client) { this.c = client; }

then call it with a c.

then it should look like this

[code]public class Packets {
client c;

public Packets(client client) {
this.c = client;
}

// dumbpackets.
then after you’ve declared that. you can do what you wanted to do make sure to put that^ at the top.

[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: [Delta] absX and absY in another class than client

item.title: [Delta] absX and absY in another class than client
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

So, I need a way to use absX and absY in my playerHandler class. I’ll show you an example and what the outcome is in the compiler.

if (client.isInLobby(absX, absY) && (players[i] != null) && !players[i].disconnected) { count++; }
(Note: I’ve also tried c.absX, c.absY)

The compiler says that it cannot find symbol absX or absY.

PlayerHandler.java:46: cannot find symbol symbol : variable absX location: class PlayerHandler if (client.isInHungerLobby(absX, absY) && (players[i] != null) && !players[i].disconnected) { ^ PlayerHandler.java:46: cannot find symbol symbol : variable absY location: class PlayerHandler if (client.isInHungerLobby(absX, absY) && (players[i] != null) && !players[i].disconnected) { ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
item.source: [Delta] absX and absY in another class than client
